pr_title: GEODE-7954: restore redundancy and status redundancy gfsh commands

timeline.message:
GEODE-7954: restore redundancy and status redundancy gfsh commands

- Add redundancyStatus method to RestoreRedundancyOperation interface
- Add RestoreRedundancyCommand
- Add StatusRedundancyCommand
- Add RedundancyCommandFunction for use by the new commands
- Create RedundancyCommandUtils to hold shared code used by both
commands
- Unit and DUnit tests for all the above

Authored-by: Donal Evans <doevans@pivotal.io>

timeline.bodyText: consider get rid of the try/catch block, the CliFunction already handles any exception thrown by the child in a uniform way.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: since this command doesn't affect cluster configuration at all. I would just have this command extend GfshCommand. SingleGfshCommand is used by command that needs to change the cluster configuration.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: same here, extends GfshCommand should be enough here.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: If you want to truly test the command like how it's invoked using the gfsh command and examine the result, you can use the GfshParserRule and create a spy of the command class to interact with it. See CreateRegionCommandTest as an example.
timeline.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText: The results should be being examined in the DUnit tests for these commands, so the unit tests are just intended to confirm that the methods in the class are providing the expected behaviour.
replies.author: DonalEvans

timeline.message:
Addressing review comments

- Have the gfsh commands extend GfshCommand instead of SingleGfshCommand
- Remove unnecessary try/catch from RedundancyCommandFunction

Authored-by: Donal Evans <doevans@pivotal.io>

Fix LGTM alerts

Authored-by: Donal Evans <doevans@pivotal.io>

timeline.message:
Applying review feedback

- Refactored tests to reduce code duplication
- Refactored to condense duplicated Restore and Status command code into
one class
- Refactored to condense unit tests for the above classes into one class

Authored-by: Donal Evans <doevans@pivotal.io>
